com.pgmacdesign.pgmacutilities.utilities

Class ContactUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pgmacdesign.pgmacutilities.utilities.ContactUtilities

  • public class ContactUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is for interacting with the contact database in the user's phone. Note, it is NOT for adding new contacts, but only for querying and obtaining results Created by pmacdowell on 8/15/2016.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ContactUtilities.Contact
      Contact entity object
      static class  ContactUtilities.ContactQueryAsync
      See Javadoc on constructor below
      static class  ContactUtilities.SearchQueryFlags
      These filters add options for query results 1)ADD_ALPHABET_HEADERS - Adds alphabetically ordered headers to the top to match the First name of the contact (raw display name).
      static class  ContactUtilities.SearchTypes
      The type of search options that can be performed.

      • getPhoneQuery

        public static java.util.List<ContactUtilities.Contact> getPhoneQuery(OnTaskCompleteListener listener,
                                                                     Activity activity,
                                                                     java.lang.String query,
                                                                     int maxNumResults)
        Query the phone table within the contacts database. Used for things like phone number and type
        Parameters:
        listener - listener to pass data back on
        activity - activity for context
        query - Query to be searched
        maxNumResults - max number of results to return. if 0, no limit

      • simplifyList

        public static java.util.List<ContactUtilities.Contact> simplifyList(java.util.List<ContactUtilities.Contact> contacts)
        Simplify the list so that if the List of contacts is used in a recyclerview, the onBindView will have less overall work to do. NOTE! ONLY CALL THIS IF YOU HAVE CONTACTS WITH ONE ATTRIBUTE IN THE EMAIL, PHONE LISTS. IF THE LISTS CONTAIN MULTIPLE ADDRESSES OR EMAILS, THIS WILL ONLY KEEP THE LAST IN THE LIST
        Parameters:
        contacts - List of contacts to both iterate and update
        Returns:
        Returns the altered list with new Strings added

      • isObjectInList

        public static boolean isObjectInList(java.lang.String id,
                                     java.util.List<ContactUtilities.Contact> contacts)
        This checks (via the IDs) if a user is already in the list.
        Parameters:
        contacts - List to loop through
        Returns:
        Already in list it returns true, false if not

      • isObjectInListPos

        public static int isObjectInListPos(java.lang.String id,
                                    java.util.List<ContactUtilities.Contact> contacts)
        This checks (via the IDs) if a user is already in the list. Different than above method in that it returns the position as to where the item already is
        Parameters:
        contacts - List to loop through
        Returns:
        returns the position of the duplicate. If no duplicate, it returns -1

      • addAlphabetHeadersToList

        public static java.util.List<ContactUtilities.Contact> addAlphabetHeadersToList(java.util.List<ContactUtilities.Contact> contactList,
                                                                                boolean allLetters)
        Adds header objects (Alphabet headers) to the list
        Parameters:
        contactList - List to be altered
        allLetters - Boolean, if true, it will set ALL alphabet letters into a list (IE, Bob and Patrick in contacts, but it will still return A - Z). If false, only the letters that match the header of the next name will be included (IE, Bob and Patrick in contacts, but will only return B and P instead of the full A-Z list
        Returns:
        Altered list

      • moveFavoritesToTop

        public static java.util.List<ContactUtilities.Contact> moveFavoritesToTop(java.util.List<ContactUtilities.Contact> myList)
        Moves contacts with a favorites tag to the top of the list. If none exist, it will just return the existing list. NOTE: This must be run AFTER adding in the alphabetical characters (A, B, C) else this will not be able to be up top. (Assuming you wanted alphabetical headers)
        Parameters:
        myList - List of contacts to filter / adjust
        Returns:
        List of Contact objects

      • moveFavoritesToTop

        public static java.util.List<ContactUtilities.Contact> moveFavoritesToTop(java.util.List<ContactUtilities.Contact> myList,
                                                                          int[] positions)
        Moves contacts with a favorites tag to the top of the list. If none exist, it will just return the existing list. NOTE: This must be run AFTER adding in the alphabetical characters (A, B, C) else this will not be able to be up top. (Assuming you wanted alphabetical headers) NOTE: This method takes in an array of positions for the favorites. If the list has not been built yet, call the overloaded method without said array
        Parameters:
        myList - List of contacts to filter / adjust
        positions - positions of favorites within the myList object
        Returns:
        List of Contact objects
